messages.message:
Web Developer Opportunity in Riverton, UT

Hi Brian, 

My name is Christian, sourcing specialist here at ConsultNet.

I wanted to see if you were open to new opportunities and relocation at the moment. My client is looking for a Web Developer with 5-7 years of professional experience and experience in multiple technologies such as AngularJS, JavaScript, Java/J2EE, HTML5, NodeJS, CSS, etc. My client is requiring for the candidate to be on-site in SLC, UT and be an active member of the LDS Church and have a temple recommend. If you're not interested, would you know of any colleagues currently looking with these requirements? If you are interested, when would be a good time to talk?

Thanks and I look forward to your response!

Christian Hebert
801-997-6245 / 801-209-7142 | CHebert@consultnet.com
Everything sounds fun except for Java. :/

Are you interested in moving to Utah? We have a few positions that might fit your best interest.

Thanks!
I like Utah
4804660856 anytime after 4

I will set a reminder to call you after 4 tomorrow, is that fine? I will be out of the office at 4 due to a charity event!

Thanks, let me know so I can set up an appointment.
Tomorrow I have an interview at 4 actually.
How about when you're out of the interview? Who is it with?
Sure, that works.
Sounds good.

Hey Brian! How are you? Are you still in the market I had a few positions I wanted to send you to see if you might be interested in these roles.

Thanks, let me know!
I have a job a like but maybe I will make a mistake and get laid off immediately for one little mistake.
That's what happened at Charles Schwab as a contractor, easier to lay someone off than to tell them what is wrong.

Haha, what is your experience with the following: (years, and if recent)


Demandware 
eCommerce
JavaScript
HTML
CSS
AJAX
Restful APIs
Jenkins
Git
MVC
Jquery
AngularJS
Backbone
Knockout
OMS, ERP, CMS, CRM in eCommerce (which ones)

Thanks!

That isn't anything like this role in Phoenix, but I want to see if you had the relevant experience

Thanks!
I've used all of those professionally in the last year except backbone and demandware.
Ah! Demandware is the most important tool they want to have because they want their developer to know how to develop in Demandware all in eCommerce.
Bummer. Sounds picky. Most e-commerce is built on a recognizable programming language.
Looks like a subset of JavaScript.
Yeah, they are definitely looking for someone that has pretty much worked in Demandware their whole career. What are your thoughts on coming back to Utah, are you till open to that?
Yes, I believe it is a subset of JS just a subset for ecommerce.
I love Utah's scenery but it's too cold in the winter. How do they feel about work remote?

A lot of the clients in Utah prefer to have their employees be on-site.

I can check but I doubt there is any clients that will do remote. 

Any other locations you would be open to relocating to?
Phoenix or Colorado

I will do some searching on my own and see if there are any companies in those locations.


Thanks, look forward to speaking with you soon!
